KnowledgeBase.Title: list
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes:
Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector
FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory Brick Pair List
Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex Boolean

Function.Description: The list function creates a List from its arguments and returns the List. A period before the final argument sets the cdr of the list.

Brief.Overview: The list function creates a List from its arguments and returns the List. A period before the final argument sets the cdr of the list.
Brief.Usage: The list function is used to create a List from a collection of objects.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes:
Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector,
FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory, Pair, List
Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex, Brick

Argument.Name: .cdrValue
Argument.Note: An optional cdr value (preceded by a period).
Argument.AISTypes: Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector, FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory, Pair, List Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex, Brick

Syntax.Return: A List (a collection of pairs chained together).
